title: Sex and Love
description: What is love? This course explores evolutionary, historical, philosophical, physiological, psychological, sociological, political-economic, and anthropological perspectives on love. We examine how love has evolved, study various aspects considered biological or cultural, and address contemporary debates around the nature and uses of love, including topics such as monogamy, arranged marriage, companionship, interracial relationships, and online dating. Prerequisites: upper-division standing.
